meanings.definition: A person who is easily upset or cries often.
meanings.sent1: The little girl is such a sook when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: My brother can be a sook when he loses a game.
meanings.sent3: The sook in the movie made everyone laugh with his dramatic tears.
meanings.sent4: Her pet cat turned into a sook whenever it heard thunder.
meanings.sent5: The sook's constant tears made everyone feel sorry for him.

meanings.definition: To cry or whine in a childish manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't sook over spilt milk; just clean it up.
meanings.sent2: The toddler started to sook after dropping his toy.
meanings.sent3: I can't help but sook when I watch sad movies.
meanings.sent4: She tends to sook whenever she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent5: The puppy began to sook when left alone in the house.
